intro: Hieracium gredense, commonly known as the Gredense hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium gredense is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
